verses.verse: (The restoring of Jerusalem and Judah.) I lifted up mine eyes again, and looked, and behold, a (This is the Angel who was Christ: for in respect of his office he is ofttimes called an Angel, but in respect of his eternal essence, is God, and so called.) man with a measuring line in his hand.
Then said I, Whither goest thou? And he said unto me, To measure Jerusalem, that I may see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length thereof.
And behold, the Angel that talked with me, went forth, and another Angel went out to meet him,

And said unto him, Run, speak to this (Meaning, himself Zechariah.) young man, and say, (Signifying the spiritual Jerusalem and Church under Christ, which should be extended by the Gospel through all the world, and should need no material walls, nor trust in any worldly strength, but should be safely preserved and dwell in peace among all their enemies.) Jerusalem shall be inhabited without walls, for the multitude of men and cattle therein.

For I, saith the Lord, will be unto her a wall of (To defend my Church, to fear the enemies and to destroy them if they approach near.) fire round about, and will (In me they shall have their full felicity and glory.) be the glory in the midst of her.

Ho, ho, come (He calleth to them, which partly for fear, and partly for their own case, remained still in captivity, and so preferred their own private commodities to the benefits of God promised in his Church.) forth, and flee from the land of the North, saith the Lord: for I have scattered you into the four (As it was I that scattered you, so have I power to restore you.) winds of the heaven, saith the Lord.
(By fleeing from Babylon, and coming to the Church.) Save thyself, O Zion, that dwellest with the daughter of Babel.

For thus saith the Lord of hosts, After this (Seeing that God had begun to show his grace among you by delivering you, he continueth the same still toward you, and therefore sendeth me his Angel and his Christ to defend you from your enemies, that they shall not hurt you, neither by the way nor at home.) glory hath he sent me unto the nations, which spoiled you: for he that toucheth you, toucheth the (Ye are so dear unto God, that he can no more suffer your enemies to hurt you, than a man can abide to be thrust in the eye, Ps. 17:8.) apple of his eye.

For behold, I will lift up mine hand (Upon the heathen your enemies.) upon them: and (They shall be your servants, as you have been theirs.) they shall be a spoil to those that served them, and ye shall know that the Lord of hosts hath (This must necessarily be understood of Christ, who being God equal with his Father, was sent as he was Mediator to dwell in his Church and to govern them.) sent me.
Rejoice and be glad, O daughter Zion: for lo, I come, and will dwell in the midst of thee, saith the Lord.
And many nations shall be joined to the Lord in that day, and shall be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou shalt know that the Lord of hosts hath sent me unto thee.
And the Lord shall inherit Judah his portion in the holy land, and shall choose Jerusalem again.
Let all flesh be still before the Lord: for he is raised up out of his holy place.
